comment: Why do you need to use camera!
It needs an app lock

title: Not what I thought
comment: Didn't want to send pgp messages using an app just wanted a pgp encryption where I can enter a public pgp block and encrypt some text... And also decrypt messages, not sure where to find my public key and private key so no good for me

Seems slick. Still trying to figure out how to export the private key to use on another device.  Help, FAQ and google searchers haven't helped.  Edit:  Changed my review to 5 stars.  The developer responded to my issue within two hours..  If that's not 5 star worthy, I don't know what is!  Thanks for the help!
Click on your key, then in the menu besides the edit button there is an entry to backup your key.

title: Nice
comment: Works!

title: Great.
comment: Great product of a great team. Keep up the good work.

title: Pretty Good
comment: I had a complaint about mandatory IDs on the keys; but the same day response below helped. However I'm still not sure why an ID is mandatory in step 2 if you can remove it in the last step.  This app honestly works better than any other one I've tried, and has some great functions. I think making the UI pretty to look at also made it more confusing to use, and I still like the old minimalist layout.  I do encounter some issues trying to export pukes and importing them.
In the last screen of our key creation wizard, click on "Change key configuration". There you can edit the User ID and change/remove the email address.

title: Love the new update
comment: Love the new layout, only problem I have is when you encrypt a zip file then decrypt it, it not in a zip file format. A suggestion for a feature is to export a key into NEO through NFC
Regarding zip-file problems: Please open a new issue here: https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues and we try to help you.

title: Amazing app
comment: I never thought I would be able to encrypt a simple text message much less a full email with 4096 bit encryption. This is a great app....now if I just get my friends and coworkers to download it we can talk trash about people and no one will know what we are talking about

title: First android crypto app that works
comment: I was about to give it a mediocre rating because with K9 Mail it managed to verify signatures but not to decrypt PGP mail when I noticed that it's due to a hard to find setting: once you send your first signed mail, it lets you select an account key that will then be used for decryption and all is peachy. It should actually try all available secret keys like GPG does but this way it's still better than the alternatives

title: Easiest and Nicest Looking
comment: Was a little intimidated when learning how to sign and encrypt emails using OpenPGP, but this made getting everything up and running with K9 Mail really easy. Even if your email security method of choice is S/MIME, it's pretty hassle free to also get PGP going using OpenKeychain.

title: Can't decrypt file
comment: Always not responding since decrypt file
This should be fixed in the current release. Please try the newest version.

title: Works great!
comment: This program works great whether you use it to directly interface with K-9 mail, or in "cut and paste" mode with Gmail.

title: Full score
comment: ...and still room for improvement.  I would love to see more key data avilable in the key list, like key creation date etc.  This makes it easier to find old keys on your ring if you have a lot of them. Ideally you should be able to configure your view to your own liking. I have had the app crashing on me several times when trying to revoke keys.  Not sure what causes this yet though.   Great work!

title: Fraudulent!!!
comment: does not read or use NFC.. i don't think the developer knows what NFC stands for. And why does it need full access to my phone, data, and contacts? Fraudulent

NFC is used to connect YubiKey NEOs. The permission groups displayed in Google Play are explained in the app's description. If you don't trust us you can also compile OpenKeychain on your own and look into our source code. OpenKeychain is free software.
Looks like it syncs your data (contacts?) to the internet without your consent!?
Keys in OpenKeychain are connected to your local contacts. This happens offline, no synchronization to the Internet is done here without your consent.
Works great

title: It works great!
comment: Was originally using the Gnu Project and it kept crashing (I have lollipop). This works like a charm!

title: Essential
comment: Great app. Very easy to use and works great with K9.
can go full-edwardsnowden on this app coupled with the Yubikey Neo

title: Smooth and easy to use
comment: Well integrated into K9 mail client and provides easy and smooth PGP functionality.
Force closed! !!!!!!!!!!
Please create an issue report at https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues/new
Much easier to use than APG. Love the Material Design. Good work.

title: Yubikey NEO Support
comment: Great app with flawless Yubikey NEO support. Good features such as stripping sub-keys, searching and updating keys and exchange of data...
I'm really impressed with the new design and usability

title: Recently started renaming files
comment: Instead of retaining the original name like previous behaviour, it now seems to rename files numerically in consecutive order when encrypting multiple files, which has totally broken my use case, which was encrypting my photos and videos before uploading them to online backup storage.
Simply disable the option "Encrypt filenames" inside the drop down menu.

title: Wow
comment: I didn't even know that PGP works over NFC in Yubikey Neo. A must have!

title: Bill L
comment: After the most recent upgrade, it crashes when I try to run it. That's on Android 4.3. Cloned the project tree from GitHub, built without severe errors in Android Studio (latest), but don't know where to go from there. Need more experience with Android Studio and Java. Can someone help? I've submitted crash report from my phone (Samsung Galaxy SIII (S3), ATT style).  Sufficiently Secure: I don't understand your reply, a single "-". Please clarify.
Please create a new bug report on https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues
Very useful nowadays...

title: Mind blown
comment: I remember one i tried to use apg but was really annoying. This one is awesome and works almost perfect! ! I found a few bugs, will see if they are fixed in this latest update. Still, it's perfectly usable, must have! !

title: Best Encryption App
comment: To me, most important feature of this  app is that, it is completely open source. This app can do everything that can be done in PGP. Embeded E-mail feature would be more awesome. Thanks to the developers.

title: Was god..
comment: Now decryption of messages with Conversations fails... Please fix this!
Please try version 3.2.1, swipe away the Conversations window from the task list, and try again.

title: Crash!
comment: Every time I try to create a key it crashes and I have to force stop.  Left it for an hour one time to see if it just took a long time to generate a key. Uninstalled. Droid MAXX
Please try the newest version of OpenKeychain. The encountered bug should be fixed now.

title: Works !
comment: Works great with K-9 Mail !! :)

title: Never works! Ever
comment: Finally imported my keys and I can not decrypt anything. It keeps giving me an "integrity check error"and no one from the team is contacting me about this issue. do not download this app.
Please create an issue report at https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues/new
The best app for security and privacy
Best key manager/generator I've used.
Samsung Galaxy S4

title: Excellent
comment: This works perfectly with K-9 mail. Does exactly what I need it to do, I use it on all my mobile devices!
Хорошо работает. Жду когда сопряжение с k-9 будет закончено.

title: Best way to use GPG on the go
comment: Beautifully easy to use, works well and integrates with pass/password store app. Thanks for this, would gladly pay a few bucks to support development.

title: Simple and Functional
comment: A well thought and planned app, could use some more upgrades to the UX functionality design wise, but overall it works as its supposed to and very easy to import and backup all your keys!

title: Great!
comment: A real 5-star app (similar to APG)- flexible & resilient tool. 4096bits RSA, (512SAH) & 256 AES, a combination of almost unbreakable cypher. You can encrypt msgs, emails, files etc ... exchange public keys with your secret lover ;-) & make the life of NSA difficult. Still, make sure that ur pw is at least 16 character (combination of all). It would be great if the app can only be accessed by a PW and a facility to clear all cached texts in the clipboard when exiting (it needs an exit function). Well done!

title: Best open PGP implementation
comment: Love this app! Excelent extemsion of APG features.

title: Very glad this exists.
comment: Would pay for the features this app gives you for free. Never had any glitches or malfunctions. Works flawlessly every time. Many thanks to the developer.
Much freedoms

title: Best pgp app
comment: Best and only app for pgp keys that fully works in my opinion havnt had any probs with it on my note 3 at all

title: I really like this APP.
comment: It is a good way to keep your GPG keys with you and the support of the Yubikey NEO makes it even better.  There are still some issues (e.g. decrypting multipart emails), but that more a problem of the email app integration, not a problem of this app.

title: Great free app, little complicated
comment: Really like this app but it's the first time bothering with encryption and need a few Questions answering. If someone is asking for my PGP key, is this it? Also to the Dev, ever since downloading this when i download music via an mp3 convertor, how can i stop it being encrypted by this? Instead of just downloading to MP3 this program pops up and obviously j can't decrpt it. Ideas, thanks

title: Amazing!
comment: One of the best implementations of GPG for mobile I have seen. Better UI and features than GnuPG! It easily exchange keys, encrypt/decrypt/sign: text, files. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is, that it needs to be password protected.
Probably the best implementation of gpg on android.

title: Looks great
comment: Looks and works great, this could be a model how could a general gpg interface look like. One thing missing is access to a file manager's interface - you can only encrypt/decrypt files in Download directory or audio/video/photo files.
Fantastic App!

title: No proxy support
comment: Good app, but it does not support a proxy if one is configured in your WLAN settings. (You won't be able to look up unknown keys.)
Proxy support is now available in 3.4.1

title: Good
comment: Application works well. One thing I'd like to see added is key-import via cliboard / local file for keys that are not on any of the keyservers.
Open the menu and choose "Import from file"
The best PGP app currently available.

title: Functionality!
comment: Secure, reliable and user friendly.

title: Very slick!
comment: Updated K9 (V5.1), exported keys from APG, imported to OpenKeyChain, told K9 to use OpenKey, bada boom. Hope OpenKey keeps development pace with K9. APG has served well but languished for years between updates (but fixed security flaws promptly). Thanks for putting [sign] [crypt] functions in editor & auto decrypt/validate on opening messages. Very slick!  I'm going to cheerfully donate.

title: Awesome
comment: It took a bit of searching to find how to make it work with my YubiKey NEO and OpenPGP but once I got it working - AWESOME!!!  Update your documentation and I'll give you 5 stars.

title: Hell
comment: Yeah

title: Everything good
comment: Except when I try to decrypt from clipboard it tells me error. Wrong character in line 0 java.  I had to save the clipboard into .asc file then decrypt from file. Other than that awesome!

Could you please create a bug report here: https://github.com/openpgp-keychain/openpgp-keychain/issues/new

Then we can try to pin down why the problem happens. Are you copying the encrypted data from another application into the clipboard?

title: Love the app.
comment: Easily integrates with K9mail.  Now I need to promote gpg. But thanks for the good work.
Extremely useful and well featured. Just needs the web-of-trust fully handled (which is apparently under dev)

title: Work almost as I would like
comment: After decripting a file it should be possible to cancel the decripted file by zeroing it and making it unrecoverable with forensic tools. Another thing I miss is the possibility of revoking a key.
Regarding revocation: Go to your key, click on "Edit key", click on the first bold subkey (the master key) and choose revoke. Then save the key and distribute it.

title: drake
comment: App sucks. Keep getting error no key found. My friend is having same problem on his. Can't use app on tablet.
Please create a bug report here: https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues/new

title: Good but..
comment: Why can't I encrypt files from sources other than google drive?  Importing keys I see Dropbox but not when wanting to encrypt files.
Please report this to the Dropbox developers. They should implement the Android Storage Access Framework.

title: Works perfectly
comment: Easy to use and works well with K9

title: Error while decrypting
comment: Keeps giving me integrity check failed data has been modified..    can anyone help.
To fix bugs, we need more information, can you please open a new issue at https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues/new . We can discuss there about potential solutions.

title: The new update 2.9.2.
comment: Didn't fix the broken key problem, either, it still says no suitable key found when I try to decrypt something. Any ideas?
Please create an issue here: https://github.com/open-keychain/open-keychain/issues

title: The latest update seems to have broken my main key
comment: I had to generate a brand new key after it updated to 2.9.2, for some reason, my main key was no longer mine and I don't have any backups of the key for some reason (thought I had but must've deleted accidentally..). Other than this, it's a great frontend for using OpenPGP/GPG Keys on Android.
And works nicely with k-9 alpha.

title: Good fork of APG
comment: Integrates fine with K-9 mail

title: I've barely started
comment: But it already looks great. It generates keys, it lets you share them. What more could you want?
King
Recommended!

title: Fixed
comment: Not exactly what I expected. But whatever.

title: Excellent work!
comment: It's the best solution for privacy on Android. Thank you :)
Please try version 2.2. Your issues should be resolved now.

title: File selection not working
comment: It is grate to have a posibility of encrypting and signing messages @ Android. Anyway it is not easy to sign or encrypt a file. When choosing the file from the selection dialogue it appears not to be selected when the control gets back to the app. Fortunately there is a walkarround over this issue but still it has to be fixed.
we are already working on a fix for your problem. In the meantime please always use OI Filemanager to select files
Excellent

title: Shows great promise for real privacy rights
comment: The vendor-neutral API is a fantastic benefit to all of humanity!
Perfect App, only how register a App K9?

title: Great App, works really well!
comment: The app works really well! I have a couple of suggestions though:  - Can you also 0 second cache of password for key rather than a minimum of 15 seconds - Are there plans to implement "key validity" and "owner trust" with the storage of public keys in the contacts part of the app?  Thanks for creating such a wonderful app! =)  Thanks, Sam.

title: Finally!
comment: An attractively-designed GnuPG app! I've waited so long for this!

title: The best!!!
comment: I've tried them all, some seem to have lost momentum some just aren't there yet, but this bad boy is the bee's knees and then some. This program is bad a$$

title: failed to import keys
comment: Error: "Nothing to import". My file was pubring .asc which was created from desktop using gpg4usb
Hi, it is a pity that it does not work for you. Could you please open an issue report and send us your exported file: https://github.com/openpgp-keychain/openpgp-keychain/issues/new

title: Great app
comment: Keep up with the great work!

title: Ottima
comment: La versione 2.2 funziona benissimo nel nexus 4
Good improvement

title: Very good.
comment: Helpful developer and the app encrypts and decrypts with my imported keyring and a fancy interface to boot.

title: simply the best
comment: works good,  nice ui.  perfect for me

title: Galaxy S4
comment: Five stars as I find it brilliant.  One problem when I copy keys to clipboard I have to send to dropbox then import. The other app like this allows ......share...direct to public key import....if that makes sense. Five stars though for giving us pgp encryption on mobile device. .. A must have app. First installed app on this new phone.

title: Samsun tab2
comment: Pgp encryption made easy, thank you so so much. I think a better user guide(for dummies) could be written, I couldn't import keys but have worked it out, I've shown my family now how to use this. NSA good luck reading my communication. If you have my public key you know the rest. title: So glad some took the time to start this fork.
comment: Great job on the fork works flawlessly although since it is still in beta I will not be using my primary key but instead will be using testing key that way if I do run into issues witch I doubt I will I dont risk my primary key getting compromised.  Then again even if it was not in beta I still wouldn't trust a primary key on a mobile device.

title: Key creation doesn't work
comment: Crashes.

title: Perfect
comment: Few tiny bugs with importing from some keyservers, otherwise I love this.

title: Great software
comment: Encryption/decryption, key imports, and key management works great. Ui clean. Responsive developer.
Please try version 2.1.

title: Ex elent but new version cant generate keys on galaxy s2
comment: Cant generate keys on galaxy s2 new version

title: Excellent
comment: Thank you for this.  Imports gnupg keys cleanly.

title: Please...
comment: ...keep developing! The need for usable software like this has increased exponentially since the last update.

title: Flawless operation!
comment: Best pgp software out there!

title: Glad someone picked it up!
comment: While people are porting a full gpg suite, APG is the best option that works. The project has been abandoned though, and this fork has a much better interface. Now to file a feature request with K9 Mail and have them allow this as a pgp provider option as well.
Very good

title: Five
comment: I give it five stars for effort, working perfectly thus far.
